pages.text: Diania was a lobopodian animal that, due to its spiny form, looked like a walking cactus. It had a worm-like body and robust legs, all covered in spines. Diania may have been a benthic scavenger, which walked the sea floor in search of food. Its spines were probably for protection against predators
